fixes.name: Radial Normalised Length
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR ParamInner = SELECTEDVALUE('Radial Inner'[Display As])
VAR ParamOuter = SELECTEDVALUE('Radial Outer'[Display As])
VAR PathOrder = SELECTEDVALUE('rossmann_sales_prediction_aggregated'[Path Order])
VAR CurrentSum = CALCULATE(SUM('rossmann_sales_prediction_aggregated'[Radial Field]))
VAR WindowMax = CALCULATE(
    MAXX(
        ALLSELECTED('rossmann_sales_prediction_aggregated'),
        CALCULATE(SUM('rossmann_sales_prediction_aggregated'[Radial Field]))
    )
)
RETURN
ParamInner + IF(PathOrder = 0, 0, DIVIDE(CurrentSum, WindowMax, 0) * (ParamOuter - ParamInner))
fixes.solution_explanation: Replaced Tableau parameters with SELECTEDVALUE('ParameterName'[Display As]). ATTR([Path Order]) translated to SELECTEDVALUE('rossmann_sales_prediction_aggregated'[Path Order]). Aggregations SUM([Radial Field]) converted to SUM('rossmann_sales_prediction_aggregated'[Radial Field]). WINDOW_MAX(SUM(...)) translated to MAXX over ALLSELECTED to emulate the window max of the SUM. Used VARs for readability and DIVIDE to safely handle division.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The original Tableau expression uses aggregations (SUM) and a table calculation (WINDOW_MAX) and references parameters, which require this to be implemented as a measure in Power BI.
